title.narrative: PCP Cambodia Agro Value Chain Developmen accelerating Inclusive Markets for Smallholders (AIMS),

description.narrative: In view of UNIDO’s value chain development expertise demonstrated in SE Asian countries and rest of the developing countries in the world, and more specifically in Cambodia, UNIDO has been invited to participate in implementation of the IFAD funded ( loan and grant) Project called Accelerating Inclusive Markets for Smallholders (AIMS), for two value chains namely vegetables and backyard chicken. Major area of actions for vegetables and backyard chicken will be the value chain development including inclusive market linkage, with specific reference to tourism sector. The aim is to substitute imported vegetables and meat products and benefit local producers and traders while contributing to national foreign currency reserves. The overall objective of the Project is to promote economic diversification of smallholder farmers of Cambodia in project locations. The Project also will includ value addition of domestic products during value chain development and market linkage. They are good aquaculture practice (GAP), certification, product labelling/packaging through ‘rural transformation centres’, product branding through Geographical Indications GI (if applicable). The Project would also develop codes of practice for production of safe products to strengthen enabling environment for market integration. The activities of the propject involve additional rural service centres such as mobile disease diagnosis and vaccination centres for crop and animal protection. Overall, the project activities will include global best practices in production of vegetables and backyard chickens through technical assistance, demonstrations and piloting, based on the experiences gained in countries in the region. The proposed UNIDO interventions within AIMS will be complemented by interventions under the forthcoming Partnership Country Program (PCP) where the government will take the lead in implementing Industrial Development Policy through development of tourism and tourism-related agro value chain including establishment of SEZs and agro-industrial parks. This linkage would facilitate upgradation or scale up of agribusiness activities to export markets.
